intro: Nicotiana micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered tobacco, is a herbaceous plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants such as tomatoes and peppers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters and produces small, white or pale purple flowers. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate in shape and often have a slightly hairy texture. Nicotiana micrantha is also noted for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its use in ornamental gardening.
